newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norway Seafoods submits application for listing.
newsitem.headline: Norway Seafoods submits application for listing.

text.p: Norway Seafoods, the fisheries division of Aker RGI ASA has formally applied to be listed on the Oslo Bourse, Aker RGI said on Monday.

As part of the listing, Norway Seafood shareholder Tiger Management and funds administered by Tiger will sell a minimum 3,250,000 and a maximum 11,652,175 shares in a secondary placement in Norway and overseas, the statement said.
The price will be 55 crowns per share, it said.
About 70 percent of the placement will be to institutional investors and the remainder to private investors, Aker RGI said.
The purchase period was set at April 21-30 and Norway Seafood was expected to be listed from mid-May.
The statement was in line with an announcement by Norway Seafoods last week that the group planned to widen distribution of its stock without issuing new shares as part of the listing.
Aker RGI owns 54.8 percent of Norway Seafoods, the world's largest operator in catching and processing white fish.
The application will probably be reviewed at a stock exchange board meeting on Tuesday, the statement said.
